text: Parliamentary elections were held in the Federated States of Micronesia on 7 March 2017,Federated States Of Micronesia IFES alongside a referendum on allowing dual citizenship. Although the proposed constitutional amendment to allow dual citizenship was approved by a majority of voters, it did not pass the threshold of 75% voting in favour in at least three of the four states.FSM voters go to the polls—Dual Citizenship again fails to pass voter scrutiny Kaselehile Press, 20 March 2017 ==Electoral system== The 14 members of Congress are elected by two methods; ten are elected in single-member constituencies by first-past-the-post voting for two year terms. The four at- large Senators are elected on the basis of one from each state,Electoral system IPU for four year terms Following the elections, the President and Vice-President are elected by the Congress, with only the four at-large Senators allowed to be candidates. ==Results== ===Congress=== {| class=wikitable !State !Elected member |- |rowspan=5|Chuuk||Tiwiter Aritos |- |Victor Gouland |- |Florencio Singkoro Harper |- |Doresio Konman |- |Robson Romolow |- |Kosrae||Paliknoa K. Welly |- |rowspan=3|Pohnpei||Esmond Moses |- |Dion G. Neth |- |Femy S Perman |- |align=left|Yap||Isaac V. Figir |- |colspan=2|Source: Kaselehile Press |} ===Referendum=== The constitutional amendment to allow dual citizenship was passed in all four states, but only by more than 75% of voters in Kosrae. {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !rowspan=2|State !colspan=2|For !colspan=2|Against |- !Votes !% !Votes !% |- |align=left|Chuuk||12,735||61|| ||39 |- |align=left|Kosrae||2,694||85|| ||15 |- |align=left|Pohnpei||14,344||70.21|| ||29.79 |- |align=left|Yap||1,563||52|| ||48 |- |align=left|Total||31,336|| || || |- |align=left colspan=5|Source: Kaselehile Press, Direct Democracy |} ==References== 2017 Category:2017 in the Federated States of Micronesia Category:2017 elections in Oceania 2017 2017 Category:2017 referendums
title: 2017 Micronesian parliamentary election
